alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 14 at 8:29PM PDT until March 17 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TUESDAY TO 5 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West facing beaches of San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...From 8 AM Tuesday to 5 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
